summary: This is an email chain between legal counsel in the U.S. v. Maxwell case regarding the service of Ghislaine Maxwell's response to motions to quash a subpoena issued to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program. It shows coordination between defense and prosecution on redactions and service procedures.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell who is corresponding with the court and other counsel about serving Maxwell's response to motions to quash a subpoena.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: Chambers of Judge Alison J. Nathan requesting confirmation that Maxwell's response was served on counsel for the moving parties.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who submitted Maxwell's response to the court under temporary seal.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney who requested that Nicole Simmons submit Maxwell's response to the court.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding the case.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge in the U.S. v. Maxwell case whose chambers are involved in the correspondence.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who is seeking to subpoena the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

connections.description: Sternheim is representing Maxwell in the criminal case and is handling procedural matters related to subpoenas.
Simmons acted at Pagliuca's request to submit a court filing on behalf of Maxwell.
Both are part of Maxwell's defense team coordinating on legal filings and procedures.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Response to Motions to Quash
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team files a response to letter motions seeking to quash her Rule 17(c) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program.

events.title: Coordination on Redactions and Service
events.description: Defense counsel coordinates with the government regarding redactions to Maxwell's response and confirms service to other parties.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team issued a Rule 17(c) subpoena to the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (EVCP).
Other parties filed motions to quash Maxwell's subpoena to the EVCP.
Maxwell's response to these motions was filed under temporary seal to allow the government to propose redactions.
The government agreed to serve the moving parties after applying appropriate redactions to Maxwell's response.
This document shows procedural coordination between defense and prosecution in the Maxwell criminal case regarding evidentiary subpoenas.
